thread.title: Girls tennis: Verona sweeps Cedar Grove in rivalry match
thread.title_full: Girls tennis: Verona sweeps Cedar Grove in rivalry match

title: Girls tennis: Verona sweeps Cedar Grove in rivalry match
text:
Buy this photo Zach Gewelb/Staff Photographer Cedar Grove senior Eliese Walter hovers around the net during her second doubles match against Verona Tuesday, Oct. 21 at the Verona High School tennis courts. 
The Hillbillies swept three singles matches as senior Nell Karpinski, junior Alexis Duhaney and freshman Megan Forrest each earned victories. 
"Nell and (Alexis) played great today," Verona head coach Jonathan Thai said. "(Alexis) played clean tennis and Nell also played some nice tennis and that led to a lot of unforced errors. Megan, this is only her third varsity match and she was able to pull out the first set and that was huge for her confidence moving forward." 
Karpinski and Duhaney each won their matches 6-0, 6-0, while Forrest earned a 6-4, 6-2 victory in her third singles contest. 
The doubles matches were a bit closer, although Verona still swept both games. Sophomore Julia Cambreleng and junior Michelle Lima defeated sophomores Eliese Walter and Haley Diess 7-5, 6-3 in first doubles. Seniors Amanda Gannon and Emma Francullo earned a 6-4, 6-3 victory over sophomore Elissa Johnson and senior Ava Kreismer in second doubles. 
Despite the 5-0 loss, Cedar Grove head coach Nick Mellina said he noticed some improvement from the last time his squad took on Verona. 
"I'm pleasantly surprised. I'm proud that they're doing better than the first time we played them," Mellina said. "It's great to see. It's nice to see them apply what we do in practice. It's always great to see growth in your players. As a coach, it's nice to see because it means you're doing something right." 
The season is starting to wind down for both squads, but Thai said he still expects his team to play well moving forward. 
"There's still some competitive matches coming up and I still want to see the girls compete and play at a high level," he said. 
Karpinski is nearing the conclusion of her final season with Verona and said she wants to go out with a bang. 
"I just hope that we can win our last few matches," she said. "It would be a good way to end the season like that." 
Email: gewelb@northjersey.com
